text:
When UseCanonicalName is off (the default), trying to browse to
http://no-such.example.com/ results in an error page signed

<hr />
<address>Apache/2.0.47 (Unix) Server at no-such.example.com Port 80</address>
</body></html>
creator: erno-apbugs@erno.iki.fi

text:
It's not really clear what bug you are reporting here; please try a user support
forum for further assistance; http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
Let me try again.

I am using apache as a proxy, and trying to browse a web page at
http://no-such.example.com/. The proxy
fails to retrieve that web page. The error response page looks like it
was generated by the web server I was trying to contact, since it was
signed <address>Apache/2.0.47 (Unix) Server at no-such.example.com Port
80</address> and not, for example, <address>Apache/2.0.47 (Unix) Proxy at
proxy.myisp.net Port 8080</address>
creator: erno-apbugs@erno.iki.fi
nick@webthing.com
text:
You have a valid point regarding 2.0 error messages.  But it's moot in 2.2,
where the confusing address is omitted.
